project.teaser: The objective is to create a network/community/ecosystem of procurers and relevant stakeholders in PPI. The idea is to empower all the actors involved in PPI through this network, focusing on the procurers. We need to attract both experienced procurers and not experienced...
project.objective: The objective is to create a network/community/ecosystem of procurers and relevant stakeholders in PPI. The idea is to empower all the actors involved in PPI through this network, focusing on the procurers. We need to attract both experienced procurers and not experienced procurers if we want to succeed in this. We will also need to analyse current barriers and needs of procurers, and then create and shared tools to facilitate PPI for all the actors involved.
project.title: Healthcare Innovation Procurement Network

article.title: A network for healthcare procurement of innovation

result.title: List of identified and defined common needs
result.description: A document detailing the common needs identified in procurers through surveys and analysis.

result.title: Final twinning report
result.description: A final report summarising the results and conclusions from the twinnings that were organized over the course of the project

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - Procure4Health (Healthcare Innovation Procurement Network)
result.teaser: The overarching goal of Procure4Health is to set up and run a network of European Health and Social care (H&Sc) procurers who are responsible for deploying H&Sc innovations across the EU and associated countries, in order to define common needs and advance sound innovation...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: WG activities report
result.description: Periodic report summarizing the activities of the various Working Groups constituted during the project based on common procurement interests.

result.title: Network Platform set up
result.description: The dedicated web platform for the Network will be set up and operational.

result.title: WG activities report Update
result.description: Periodic report summarizing the activities of the various Working Groups constituted during the project based on common procurement interests.

result.title: Report of the results of the OMCs
result.description: Report detailing the results of the Open Market Consultation carried out in task 4.3

result.title: Report of the results of the Market Analysis and stakeholder consultation
result.description: Report detailing the results of the Market Analysis for the common needs identified (D4.1) as well as the stakeholders consultation

result.title: Project Website
result.description: First full version of the Project website, it will be regularly updated and adapted to the project’s needs.

result.title: Twinning's call selection list
result.description: The lists containing the selected beneficiaries of the grants as a result of the twinnings’ call scheme. Two separate lists will be sent to the Funding Agency, one on month 12, and the other in month 18

result.title: Survey conclusions report
result.description: Report summarising the conclusions from the survey carried out in task 5.1

result.title: Twinning's call scheme
result.description: The documents regulating the Financial support to third parties twinning calls. These will include the application form for the grant, guidance information and award criteria.

result.title: Procurement strategies analysis for common needs
result.description: Report detailing the most suitable strategy and procurement approach for the common needs identified (D4.1)

result.title: Capacity building catalogue and repository of resources
result.description: The Capacity Building Catalogue will address gaps in knowledge for procurers. It will comprise a set of relevant topics such as (i) PPI and PCP, (ii) sustainable innovative procurement, (iii) evaluation frameworks, (iv) Intellectual Property Rights management, (v) go to market-schemes, (vi) deployment of innovative solutions, (vii) redefinition of value chains after Covid-19, (viii) innovation procurement strategies (building on current established methodologies and best practices).The repository of resources will consolidate the materials and insights from other procurers, such as successful projects, challenges and barriers solved, results of previous OMC, mapping of existing resources and tools for attracting industry stakeholders as a key component in the collaborative process.

result.title: Interim Action Plan Report
result.description: A report of the consolidated Action Plan

result.title: Final Action Plan and endorsements report
result.description: The final version of the Action Plan and a report listing endorsement statements from procurers

result.title: WG activities report Update 2
result.description: Periodic report summarizing the activities of the various Working Groups constituted during the project based on common procurement interests.

result.title: Twinning's call selection list Update
result.description: The list containing the selected beneficiaries of the grants as a result of the twinnings’ call scheme.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
